Interface unScheduleOrder

  • All Known Subinterfaces:

    public interface unScheduleOrder

      The unScheduleOrder API unschedules a scheduled order or order line.

    • Method Detail

      • unScheduleOrder

        org.w3c.dom.Document unScheduleOrder(YFSEnvironment env,
                                     org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                              throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                     java.rmi.RemoteException
        The unScheduleOrder API unschedules a scheduled order or order line.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits:

          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSBeforeSplitLineUE
          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetExternalResourcePoolCapacityUE

        Events Raised:
        Raised under the transaction CAPACITY_CHANGE

        ON_ORDER_RELEASE_STATUS_CHANGE:

          This event is raised when an order release status is changed for the order.
          Data published - YFS_ORDER_CHANGE.ON_ORDER_RELEASE_STATUS_CHANGE.xml
          Key data - modifyOrder_dbd.txt
          Template Support - Yes.

        Raised under the transaction CAPACITY_CHANGE
          ON_STD_CAPACITY_FREED:
            Raised when consumption is freed and standard capacity becomes available for the day.
            Data Published: INV_CAPACITY_CHANGE.ON_STD_CAPACITY_FREED.html
            Template Support: Yes
            Configuration Required for backward compatibility: No
          EXTERNAL_CAPACITY_CHANGE:
            This event is raised when capacity consumptions are changed.
            Data published: YFS_CAPACITY_CHANGE.EXTERNAL_CAPACITY_CHANGE.xml
            Template Support: Yes
            Configuration Required for backward compatibility: No

        Raised under the transaction INVENTORY_CHANGE

          INVENTORY_CHANGE.EXTERNAL_DEMAND_CHANGE:
            Raised when there is a demand update.
            Key Data: INVENTORY_CHANGE_EXTERNAL_DEMAND_CHANGE_dbd.txt
            Data Published: INV_INVENTORY_CHANGE.EXTERNAL_DEMAND_CHANGE.html
            Template Support: Yes
          INVENTORY_CHANGE.EXTERNAL_SUPPLY_CHANGE:
            Raised when there is a supply update.
            Key Data: INVENTORY_CHANGE_EXTERNAL_SUPPLY_CHANGE_dbd.txt
            Data Published: INV_INVENTORY_CHANGE.EXTERNAL_SUPPLY_CHANGE.html
            Template Support: Yes

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: No

        Database Extensibility Support: No

        Configuration Required for Backward Compatibility: No

        Additional Information:
        The unScheduleOrder API outputs with a status of UnScheduled (1310). This status is equivalent to being backordered.

        Unscheduling a DS line would result in loss of capacity allocated earlier (if any) and the ApptStatus would be marked as INVALID. The capacity is then available for use for other delivery lines. A PS line cannot be unscheduled directly. However, cancellation of work order results in unschedule of PS line.

        The unScheduleOrder API will split any line that is being partially unscheduled. The portion being unscheduled will be split into a new line. This is controlled by the Split On Backorder of Line With Firm Predefined Node rule and Split On Backorder of Line Without Firm Predefined Node rule based upon.if the IsFirmPredefinedNode flag on the order line is set to Y or N respectively. This only applies when the Use Single Node For Line Fulfillment rule is set to Y.

        Chained Order Cancellation

        When unscheduling a line that has a chained order, only drop ship and procurement orders will be canceled automatically if modification rules permit CANCEL on the chained order line. Any other chained orders will have to be manually canceled.

        Release Cancellation

        If release modification rules do allow CANCEL for a given order release line, releases will be canceled as well as the line getting unscheduled.

        Shipment Cancellation

        If a release cannot be canceled, its associated shipments will not be canceled. When unscheduling a line that is in a shipment for a WMS node, cancellation of the shipment will only occur if the shipment line has not yet been packed. If the shipment is packed or the shipment is against a nonWMS node, the line will be skipped for unscheduling.

        Removing Products from Work Orders

        When the RemoveProductFromWorkOrder flag is passed, all products unscheduled will be removed from their work orders if modification rules for the work order allow PRODUCT_LINE_CHANGE. In the case where a product cannot be removed from the work order, the line will not be unscheduled and associations will remain intact. Product associations to delivery service items will be removed if the UNSCHEDULE_PROD_FROM_WO_MODE rule is set to "01" (remove all associations) and thus cancel the service line if all associations are removed. Any changes needed for Provided Service lines will have to be done manually (such as removing associations, removing from work orders, etc.).
        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        None
        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
